request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release and Disclose Patient Information (MC032)
Fax signed authorization to ROI department
Drop off or pick up at any ROI office (Main, Wick/CHC, North)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a generic HIPAA authorization form designed for all releases, listing themselves as both source and destination; an online request tool is also available as an alternative.

red_flags: No fillable fields on a natively digital PDF despite being created in a PDF editor
Vague fee disclosure with no specific amounts or schedule provided
bright_spots: Dedicated full-page instruction sheet with section-by-section guidance
Multiple ROI contact points across three offices with phone, fax, and email
Explicitly accepts any HIPAA-compliant authorization form including the Minnesota Standard Consent Form
Online medical record request tool available as an alternative to the PDF form
Modernized plain-language labels in the current form revision

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with a single web search surfacing direct PDF links and a dedicated ROI page; minor concern that two form versions are live without deprecation notice.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: The PDF form has zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite, but fax and email submission are available; the separate online request tool provides a digital alternative but the downloaded form itself is paper-first.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with clear section headers, plain-language labels, logical flow, and an unusually helpful instruction page; minor issue with the two-party structure being confusing for self-requests.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic authorization form for self-access but must figure out the source/destination fields; no mention of HIPAA Right of Access or patient rights, and the form was not designed for patient self-requests.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Proper authorization expiration, treatment conditioning language, and re-disclosure warning; minor ambiguity in fee disclosure ('there may be a charge') without specifying amounts, and no patient rights statement.

overall.summary: Mankato Clinic makes forms easy to find and offers multiple submission channels including an online tool, but the generic authorization framing, non-fillable PDF, and vague fee disclosure limit the patient experience.
